IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF THE PUBLIC AND ACHIEVE EQUITY IN HEALTH STATUS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: APHA AIMS TO PROTECT ALL AMERICANS FROM PREVENTABLE, SERIOUS HEALTH THREATS AND STRIVES TO ASSURE COMMUNITY-BASED HEALTH PROMOTION AND DISEASE PREVENTION ACTIVITIES AND PREVENTIVE HEALTH SERVICES ARE UNIVERSALLY ACCESSIBLE IN THE UNITED STATES.
IRS990.Desc: SCIENTIFIC AND PROFESSIONAL AFFAIRS - APHA ADVANCED PUBLIC HEALTH SCIENCES, POLICIES, AND PRACTICES THROUGH INFORMATION, COMMUNICATION, AND COLLABORATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONVENTION - THE ANNUAL EXPOSITION CONVENED OVER 12,000 PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS REPRESENTING OVER 80 DISCIPLINES IN PUBLIC HEALTH AND RELATED FIELDS, WORKING TO IMPROVE THE PUBLIC'S HEALTH.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PERIODICALS - APHA PUBLISHED SEVERAL EDUCATIONAL PERIODICALS IN THE AREA OF PUBLIC HEALTH MADE AVAILABLE TO MEMBERS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: MEMBERSHIP SERVICES - APHA REPRESENTS A BROAD ARRAY OF HEALTH PROFESSIONALS AND OTHERS WHO CARE ABOUT THEIR OWN HEALTH AND THE HEALTH OF THEIR COMMUNITIES.

GOVERNMENT RELATIONS AND AFFILIATES AFFAIRS - APHA BUILDS A COLLECTIVE VOICE FOR PUBLIC HEALTH, WORKING TO ENSURE ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE, PROTECT FUNDING FOR CORE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES, AND ELIMINATE HEALTH DISPARITIES, AMONG A MYRIAD OF OTHER ISSUES.
BOOK PUBLISHING - APHA PUBLISHED A NUMBER OF PUBLIC HEALTH BOOKS TO PROMOTE AND SPREAD KNOWLEDGE OF VARIOUS PUBLIC HEALTH MATTERS.

AWARD PROGRAMS - REPRESENTS THE COSTS OF ADMINISTERING VARIOUS AWARDS DESIGNED TO RECOGNIZE INDIVIDUALS WHO EXEMPLIFY OUTSTANDING PROFESSIONALISM AND DEDICATION TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND HAS MADE EXTRAORDINARY CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE FIELD OF PUBLIC HEALTH.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION ADHERES TO THE PROVISIONS OF THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD CODIFICATION 740, INCOME TAXES (ASC 740). ASC 740 PRESCRIBES A COMPREHENSIVE MODEL FOR FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION, MEASUREMENT, CLASSIFICATION AND DISCLOSURE OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ASSOCIATION CONCLUDED THAT THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO FISCAL YEAR 2020

THE ASSOCIATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS PRIMARILY OF FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR AWARD PROGRAMS. THE ASSOCIATION'S ENDOWMENT IS DONOR-RESTRICTED AND IS TO BE HELD IN PERPETUITY SO AS TO GENERATE RETURNS TO FUND THE AWARD PROGRAMS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: COUNCIL ON EDUCATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH
INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF THE CHIEF OF POLICE BALTIMORE
NAPHSIS-NATIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH STATISTICS
STATE OF TENESSSEE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
UNVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA CHAPEL HILL

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: THE KAISER PERMANENTE NATIONAL COMMUNITY BENEFIT FUND AT THE EAST BAY COMMUNITY FOUNDATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION SEEKS MONTHLY PROGRAM AND FINANCIAL (WHERE APPROPRIATE) REPORTS FROM GRANTEES BEFORE PAYMENT AND ASSESS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH AWARD AGREEMENT. BY DESIGN, SOME GRANTEES WOULD HAVE MET REQUIREMENTS SET BY FUNDERS TO RECEIVE GRANT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS HAVE THE RIGHT TO HOLD OFFICE, TO VOTE, OR TO SERVE THE ASSOCIATION IN ANY CAPACITY. INDIVIDUAL MEMBERSHIP CLASSES ARE AS FOLLOWS: - REGULAR - STUDENT - EARLY CAREER PROFESSIONALS - RETIRED - RE2 - STUDENT BULK - AGENCY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING COUNCIL CONSISTS OF : (1) TWO ELECTED REPRESENTATIVES OF EACH SECTION, WITH ADDITIONAL NUMBERS OF ELECTED REPRESENTATIVES OF EACH SECTION, AND 5 MEMBERS OF THE STUDENT ASSEMBLY, AS ANNUALLY ENDORSED BY THE EXECUTIVE BOARD; (2) ONE REPRESENTATIVE TO BE DESIGNATED BY EACH AFFILIATED ASSOCIATION; (3) ONE REPRESENTATIVE FOR UNAFFILIATED SPECIAL INTEREST GROUPS; AND (4) MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE BOARD. EX-OFFICIO GOVERNING COUNCIL MEMBERS MAY ALSO SERVE, BUT DO NOT HAVE ANY VOTING RIGHTS. THE EXECUTIVE BOARD SERVES AS APHA'S GOVERNING BODY. THE EXECUTIVE BOARD IS 24-MEMBER BODY AND COMPOSED OF 17 ELECTED MEMBERS; OUT OF WHICH 5 ARE OFFICERS AND 7 ARE EX-OFFICIO-3 VOTING AND 4 NON-VOTING. THE EXECUTIVE BOARD MEMBERS ARE ELECTED AMONG INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION FOR TERMS OF FOUR YEARS EACH BY THE GOVERNING COUNCIL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT REVIEWS THE FORM 990 AND THEN FORWARDS IT TO THE FINANCE AND AUDIT COMMITTEE TO REVIEW AND APPROVE. THE EXECUTIVE BOARD IS ALSO PROVIDED A LINK FOR THEM TO ELECTRONICALLY ACCESS THE RETURN FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO THE RETURN BEING FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE BOARD'S GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE ANNUALLY MONITORS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH THE SUBMISSION OF COMPLETED CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS, AND AT OTHER TIMES WHEN NEEDED. THE ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF RETAINS THE DOCUMENTS. A DISCLOSURE AND SUBSEQUENT ABSTENTION FROM VOTING ON THE MATTER AT ISSUE SHALL BE MADE A MATTER OF RECORD WITHIN THE MINUTES OF THE APPROPRIATE MEETING. ONCE INDIVIDUALS HAVE DISCLOSED A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THEY MAY PARTICIPATE IN THE DISCUSSION/DELIBERATIONS OF THE EXECUTIVE BOARD MEETING, BUT MUST BE RECUSED FROM THE VOTING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN PREPARATION FOR APHA'S ANNUAL REVIEW OF ITS EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE PROVIDES THE EXECUTIVE BOARD MEMBERS WITH A COPY OF THEIR EVALUATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S OUTLINED CURRENT YEAR OBJECTIVES; THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S OWN SELF-EVALUATION; THE RESULTS OF A STAFF SURVEY, IF APPLICABLE (THESE ARE ONLY CONDUCTED EVERY FEW YEARS); AND AN INDEPENDENT EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION ANALYSIS. THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE THEN REVIEWS THE EXECUTIVE BOARD'S EVALUATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. AFTER THE RESULTS ARE COMPILED, THEN THERE IS A REVIEW OF THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION ANALYSIS. THE COMPENSATION VENDOR IS AVAILABLE TO ANSWER ANY QUESTIONS FROM THE ANALYSIS. THE ANALYSIS USES INFORMATION ABOUT APHA SUCH AS THE TYPE OF MEMBERSHIP OF THE ASSOCIATION, THE ASSOCIATION'S AREA OF FOCUS, ANNUAL GROSS REVENUES, THE ASSOCIATION'S LOCATION, AND THE TENURE OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IN ORDER TO ARRIVE AT A PREDICTED TOTAL COMPENSATION AMOUNT. TOTAL COMPENSATION ANALYSIS IS DEFINED AS BASE SALARY, BONUS, CASH VALUE, DEFERRED COMPENSATION, SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT AND PENSION AMOUNTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: APHA MAKES ITS BYLAWS AND CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC ON THE ASSOCIATION'S WEBSITE. THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON REQUEST.
CONSULTING AND TEMPORARY SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 2,103,423. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 688,449. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 22,343. TOTAL EXPENSES 2,814,215.
THE AUDIT OVERSIGHT PROCESS HAS REMAINED UNCHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS YEAR.
